amendatorysection.para: Sheep to be moved in Nebraska from one farm or ranch to another farm or ranch must not be diverted en route. Sheep being moved to a county within an area designated as scabies free may move without restriction if from a county of the same status or under special permit from the State Veterinarian if the native flock has been inspected and found free by a state or federal inspector or accredited veterinarian prior to movement. In the alternative, sheep may be moved on permit after being dipped in a permitted dip maintained at a required strength under the supervision of a state or federal inspector in accordance with the directions issued by the Department of Agriculture, Bureau of Animal Industry within ten days prior to movement.
